sentences.sContent: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.sCn: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.sContent: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.sCn: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.sContent: The company had been very badly managed.
I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.sCn: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.sContent: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.sCn: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

sentences.sContent: ...People rarely manage to quit the first time they try...
...That’s why leaders continue to manage the present while building toward the big changes of the future...
...organisations need to learn something bigger than how to manage teams better: they need to be in the habit of asking themselves whether teams are the best tools for the job...
...Leaders have to be able to delegate and manage resources wisely – including staff expertise...
...Just when you had figured out how to manage fat in your diet...
...what can you do to manage conflict in your own relationships...
...They feared neither spouse could manage alone...
...Most people who get in trouble do know the rules and facts but manage to fool themselves about the risks they're taking by using excuses: Everyone else does it...

phrases.pCn: 挣扎做某事；设法完成某事
没有…而仍设法对付过去

words.tran: 易管理的；易控制的；易办的
管理；管理人员；管理部门；操纵；经营手段

trans.tranCn: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
trans.tranOther: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it
